TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ServiceAccount extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies a service's security context, which defines its logon type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the ServiceAccount enumeration when you initialize a <xref:System.ServiceProcess.ServiceProcessInstaller> to specify the security context of the service you are installing. The security context indicates the privileges a service has on the system and how the services act on the network (for example, whether the service presents the computer's credentials or anonymous credentials to remote servers). The ServiceAccount enumeration provides a range of privileges so that you can specify exactly the privileges you need for any particular service.
The `LocalSystem` value defines a highly privileged account, but most services do not require such an elevated privilege level. The `LocalService` and `NetworkService` enumeration members provide a lower privilege level for the security context.
> [!NOTE] > The values `LocalService` and `NetworkService` are available only on Windows XP and Windows Server 2003 family.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the ServiceAccount enumeration to install new programs by using the system account's security context.
[!code-cpp[Classic ServiceInstaller Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.serviceprocess._5_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[Classic ServiceInstaller Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.serviceprocess._5_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Classic ServiceInstaller Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.serviceprocess._5_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceProcess.ServiceAccount LocalSystem = int32(2)

Docs.summary: An account defined by a specific user on the network. Specifying for the <xref:System.ServiceProcess.ServiceProcessInstaller.Account%2A?displayProperty=fullName> member causes the system to prompt for a valid user name and password when the service is installed, unless you set values for both the <xref:System.ServiceProcess.ServiceProcessInstaller.Username%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceProcess.ServiceProcessInstaller.Password%2A> properties of your instance.
